Articles.Content:
Hello to everyone in the KSP community!

I have been playing for a while now and thought it was about time I did the honourable thing and signed up for the forums (I have been a lurker for a while, checking back every now and then). I enjoy the game immensely - it is truly one of a kind and I can't wait for future updates.

I also come bearing a message for anyone that is interested:

A while ago I set up a UK-based server to host forums, VOIP and any games we should wish to play and I am looking for anyone that is interested to get involved to re-energise the place.

This is not a 'guild', it is more of a group of friends that share the same love for gaming. As such, there are no requirements or expectations (other than a sense of humour). I simply want to gather a nice crowd together so there is always someone to play with and talk to.

We offer a Mumble (VOIP) server for anyone that wishes to use it, website forums and private messaging. Some of the games we have been playing recently include: KSP, Neverwinter, Garry's Mod, Alien Swarm, Borderlands 2 and more.

If you are interested, don't hesitate to sign up at http://www.jimbobslimbob.com - where I also have some images of some of my (and other users) brilliant KSP creations.
Hello and welcome to the Kerbal Space Program forum! Always feel free to ask questions or suggestions in their correct place! Have fun, and enjoy your stay.

Welcome to the forums!

To add on to what austin is saying: I'd highly recommend that you (or any players from your group) check out the Drawing Board (link in my sig). It has a number of useful resources that can be of use to anyone of any skill level, from the absolute beginner to the veteran pilot.

Hope to see you and your friends around the forums, and happy landings!

Hi! welcome to all.I am Alex and new here.I am glad to join this forum.I am sure this is the best place to share and discuss all new relevant things.Its gonna to be a very nice job.Thanks to all here.
